conclusion: To determine whether the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is greater than or less than 75 meters, we need to calculate the area under the velocity-time graph for that interval.
The interval of interest is from t = 10 seconds to t = 15 seconds.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is 20 m/s.
At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s.
The graph shows a linear decrease in velocity from 20 m/s to 10 m/s over 5 seconds.

premise: The graph shows a linear decrease in velocity from 20 m/s to 10 m/s over 5 seconds.
conclusion: This forms a trapezoid under the graph.
The formula for the area of a trapezoid is: Area = 1/2 × (Base1 + Base2) × Height.

premise: Base1 = 20 m/s, Base2 = 10 m/s, and Height = 5 seconds.
conclusion: Plug in the values: Area = 1/2 × (20 + 10) × 5 = 1/2 × 30 × 5 = 75 meters.
The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters.
